  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "ApplyBoard simplifies the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process by connecting international students, recruitment partners, and academic institutions on one platform. With an exceptional team from around the world and speaking more than 75 languages, our diversity is one of our greatest strengths. Our core values, such as Caring About Each Other, Innovating and Improving, and Making Work Fun, propel us forward together and continuously strengthen our engaging culture. We are in growth mode and are looking to empower passionate and exceptionally talented team members.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Opportunity


	This role is a frontline, partner manager responsible for managing, nurturing, and growing a portfolio of recruitment partners (RPs).
	This role is accountable for relationship management, enrollment delivery, and increasing RP engagement and wallet share through personalized support, training, and data-driven performance conversations.


Responsibilities
What you&#39;ll be doing everyday:


	Act as an ambassador for ApplyBoard, representing our mission and services to educational agents, international institutions, and prospective students.
	Cultivate a deep understanding of ApplyBoard&rsquo;s value and offerings, ensuring effective promotion to a diverse audience of students and educational partners.
	Develop and execute strategies to increase international student enrollment, recruiting from a wide array of regions to join ApplyBoard&rsquo;s network.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with agents, negotiating terms, providing comprehensive training, and maintaining active engagement through consistent communication.
	Guide and train agents to improve the quality and volume of student applications, ensuring adherence to ApplyBoard&rsquo;s standards.
	Use CRM and social media platforms to share key messages, disseminate information, and drive engagement among potential and current students.
	Develop and implement data-driven recruitment and marketing strategies informed by market research to optimize ApplyBoard&rsquo;s international outreach.
	Expand ApplyBoard&rsquo;s international presence, ensuring that more students worldwide gain access to quality education.


Requirements
What you bring to the table:


	A bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Education) is preferred.
	2-3 years of managing recruitment or enterprise accounts, ideally within the international education sector.
	Fluent in English; additional language skills are an asset.
	Ability to engage and motivate diverse stakeholders, from students to educational agents, with clear and persuasive communication.
	A self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, team-based environment and works effectively independently.
	Excellent organizational skills with a talent for managing priorities and ensuring accuracy in information and communications.
	Resourceful problem-solver capable of navigating complex situations to deliver positive outcomes for students and partners.
	Proficient in CRM systems; experience with social media and other digital engagement tools is an advantage.

Business Development Manager Job at ApplyBoard




        
    

        
        ApplyBoard simplifies the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process by connecting international students, recruitment partners, and academic institutions on one platform. With an exceptional team from around the world and speaking more than 75 languages, our diversity is one of our greatest strengths. Our core values, such as Caring About Each Other, Innovating and Improving, and Making Work Fun, propel us forward together and continuously strengthen our engaging culture. We are in growth mode and are looking to empower passionate and exceptionally talented team members. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Opportunity


	This role is a frontline, partner manager responsible for managing, nurturing, and growing a portfolio of recruitment partners (RPs).
	This role is accountable for relationship management, enrollment delivery, and increasing RP engagement and wallet share through personalized support, training, and data-driven performance conversations.


Responsibilities
What you'll be doing everyday:


	Act as an ambassador for ApplyBoard, representing our mission and services to educational agents, international institutions, and prospective students.
	Cultivate a deep understanding of ApplyBoard’s value and offerings, ensuring effective promotion to a diverse audience of students and educational partners.
	Develop and execute strategies to increase international student enrollment, recruiting from a wide array of regions to join ApplyBoard’s network.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with agents, negotiating terms, providing comprehensive training, and maintaining active engagement through consistent communication.
	Guide and train agents to improve the quality and volume of student applications, ensuring adherence to ApplyBoard’s standards.
	Use CRM and social media platforms to share key messages, disseminate information, and drive engagement among potential and current students.
	Develop and implement data-driven recruitment and marketing strategies informed by market research to optimize ApplyBoard’s international outreach.
	Expand ApplyBoard’s international presence, ensuring that more students worldwide gain access to quality education.


Requirements
What you bring to the table:


	A bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Education) is preferred.
	2-3 years of managing recruitment or enterprise accounts, ideally within the international education sector.
	Fluent in English; additional language skills are an asset.
	Ability to engage and motivate diverse stakeholders, from students to educational agents, with clear and persuasive communication.
	A self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, team-based environment and works effectively independently.
	Excellent organizational skills with a talent for managing priorities and ensuring accuracy in information and communications.
	Resourceful problem-solver capable of navigating complex situations to deliver positive outcomes for students and partners.
	Proficient in CRM systems; experience with social media and other digital engagement tools is an advantage.

title: HR / Recruitment Officer Job at Buckler Systems
content:
Buckler Systems is a Nigerian defense solutions provider with strong expertise in manufacturing civilian armored vehicles, design, and prototyping of military vehicles and ordnance equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Recruitment Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking a talented and passionate HR and Recruitment Officer to join our esteemed Human Resources team.
	If you excel in Recruitment duties and are eager to contribute to a dynamic and forward-thinking organization, we want to hear from you.
	Our commitment to excellence has positioned us as leaders in the industry, and we are continually pushing the boundaries of what is possible.
	Our Human Resources team is integral to our success, ensuring that we attract, retain, and develop top talent in the industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Talent Acquisition: Lead and manage the full recruitment cycle, including job postings, candidate sourcing, interviewing, and selection.
	Onboarding: Facilitate a seamless onboarding process for new hires, ensuring they are well-integrated into the company culture and equipped for success.
	Employee Relations: Serve as a point of contact for employee queries and issues, fostering a positive and supportive workplace environment.
	HR Administration: Maintain and update employee records, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
	Performance Management: Support performance appraisal processes, providing guidance and feedback to employees and managers.
	HR Projects: Contribute to the development and implementation of HR initiatives and projects that enhance organizational effectiveness.


Qualifications


	Educational Background: A Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred.
	Experience: 2-4 years of proven experience in HR and recruitment roles, with a strong understanding of best practices and employment legislation.
	Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships across all levels of the organization.
	Organizational Skills: Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
	Problem-Solving Ability: Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive issues with discretion and implement effective solutions.


Why Join Buckler Systems?


	Professional Development: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement in a supportive and innovative environment.
	Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and professional growth.
	Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package commensurate with your skills and experience.


Note: If you are ready to contribute to our success and grow with us, we want to hear from you.

        Talent City - Our client, a conglomerate with subsidiaries in Oil & Gas, Fintech, Banking, Real Estate and Media, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Accounts

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Group Chief Financial Officer (CFO)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an exceptional, results driven and detail-oriented Head of Accounts to oversee the financial accounting functions across our diversified group of companies.
	The Head of Accounts will be responsible for managing accounting operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, maintaining strong internal controls, compliance with industry regulations, and supporting strategic financial planning across the group's subsidiaries.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee preparation of timely financial statements in line with IFRS and local accounting standards
	Consolidate group financials and ensure compliance with statutory reporting requirements..
	Coordinate monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes across subsidiaries.
	Establish and enforce robust internal control policies and procedures to safeguard company assets.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations, financial laws, and corporate governance standards.
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies as required.
	Support the CFO in the development and monitoring of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
	Analyze financial performance against budgets and provide insights tomanagement for decision-making.
	Monitor and manage the company’s cash flow, banking relationships, and funding requirements.
	Ensure efficient treasury operations andoptimizeworking capital management.
	Lead, mentor, and develop the finance and accounting team across the group.
	Promote continuous improvement in processes, systems, and team capabilities.
	Oil & Gas: Track capital expenditures, cost recovery, JV accounting, and upstream/downstream reporting.
	Fintech: Oversee digital revenue streams, transaction reconciliations, and CBN compliance.
	IT: Manage project-based accounting, licensing revenue, and software cost capitalization.
	Ensure the remittance of VAT & WHT in FIRS Tax-promax platform.


What We’re Looking For


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field; Master’s Degree is an added advantage.
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in Accounting and Finance, with at least 4 years in a leadership role.
	Professional certification such as ICAN, ACCA, or CPA is mandatory.
	Experience working in or across Oil & Gas, Fintech or Banking is desirable.


Desired Competencies:


	Deep knowledge of IFRS, Nigerian tax laws, and regulatory frameworks.
	Strong financial analysis and reporting skills.
	Proficiency in accounting software.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and team management skills.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.
